thread.title: ACC Tournament 2017 results and bracket: Duke’s huge 2nd half comeback vs. North Carolina sends them to the finals
thread.title_full: ACC Tournament 2017 results and bracket: Duke’s huge 2nd half comeback vs. North Carolina sends them to the finals

author: Tim Cato
title: ACC Tournament 2017 results and bracket: Duke’s huge 2nd half comeback vs. North Carolina sends them to the finals
text:
Duke was down 13 points with 14 minutes left in the second half, and ended up winning by 10.
Duke could be the first team without a first round bye to win the AAC tournament, after beating the tournament’s No. 1 seed North Carolina 93-83 in Friday’s conference semifinals. They will play the winner of Florida State vs. Notre Dame on Saturday.
It took a huge second half comeback for the Blue Devils to surge back against UNC, who led 61-48 with 14 minutes left in the third quarter after a Kennedy Meeks layup. From that moment forward, Duke’s offense came to life, with Jayson Tatum scoring 24 points and Luke Kennard dropping 20 on just seven shots.
North Carolina built their first half lead off strong play from Meeks , Isaiah Hicks and Justin Jackson. They led 49-42 at halftime, before building that lead to 13 early in the second half. After that, Duke dominated the rest of the way.
No one has ever won four straight games to take the ACC tournament title, like Duke is poised to do with one more win. Tatum and Luke Kennard’s late season surges has made them a more dangerous team than their record suggested, and they beat Clemson on Wednesday and nationally ranked No. 10 Louisville by four points on Thursday. North Carolina is also nationally ranked at No. 6 in the country, but Duke’s comeback pushed them past the Tar Heels.
No. 2 Florida State vs. No. 3 Notre Dame 
The other game in the tournament’s semifinals will be played at 9 p.m. on ESPN immediately after this game.
Saturday, March 11 (Finals) 
Duke vs. Florida State-Notre Dame winner, 9 p.m., ESPN
